div.p: It was about a year ago that I was struggling again because I felt I was in a dead-end job and I wasn’t going anywhere
I wasn’t climbing the ladder, I couldn’t see any, I don’t know I just couldn’t see any way I could progress where I was.
When you do take time away from it and you think about what you need to do, you know, and you’re feeling that low
that you need to do something about it it does give you that kick up the bum to just think right that’s enough now I need to
sort myself out and support from my mum and my dad to make it happen really so yeah they have helped me but I think
it’s nice to have their support but also I needed to do the majority of it, I needed to push it and I think I needed to be
the force behind it because they can give me all the support in the world but if I’m not willing to put the graft in
it’s not going to go anywhere do you know what I mean? But they have been brilliant... She paid me to say that!
